interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Heat Review Date: 2015/01/17 Store: Sandra Bullock (Actor), Melissa McCarthy (Actor), Paul Feig (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michael Rapaport, Paul Feig, Taran Killam, Michael McDonald, Peter Chernin, Dan Bakkedahl, Brandon Richardson, Marlon Wayans, Sandra Bullock, Melissa McCarthy, Jenno Topping, Spoken Reasons, Katie Dippold, Tom Wilson, Demian Bichir, Jane CurtinMichael Rapaport, Paul Feig, Taran Killam, Michael McDonald, Peter Chernin, Dan Bakkedahl, Brandon Richardson, Marlon Wayans, Sandra Bullock, Melissa McCarthy, Jenno Topping, Spoken Reasons, Katie Dippold, Tom Wilson, Demian Bichir, Jane Curtin See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 57 minutes'} Review Text: I did not like this movie AT ALL. I attempted to write a review without clicking any stars, but found that was impossible.

There was so much contention and foul language, I never figured out what the story line was. I bought it new right after it came out. A friend watched with me. We both felt the same about the movie, that it was a waste of money. I donated to Goodwill. Maybe they can make some money on it since it won awards. Review Title: I did not like this movie AT ALL Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile: The user exhibits a strong aversion to comedies that rely heavily on foul language and conflict, indicating a preference for cleaner content with clear storylines. Despite purchasing popular titles shortly after release, they express disappointment in this particular film, deeming it a waste of money. Their action of donating the DVD signifies a desire to part with items they find unsatisfactory rather than keeping them. Additionally, the user's inclination towards sharing their views suggests they value personal opinions in influencing their purchases. Overall, the user tends to favor films that prioritize coherent storytelling over crude humor, leaning towards genres that align with these traits, and they actively engage in providing feedback on their experiences.
